intro: Satureja pisidia, commonly known as Turkish thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja pisidia thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or dry environments.
